meanings.definition: The act or art of using a sword or foil for defense and attack.
meanings.sent1: In the fencings class, students learn how to parry and thrust with precision.
meanings.sent2: The fencings competition showcased the skill and agility of the participants.
meanings.sent3: During the fencings tournament, the fencers showed off their quick reflexes.
meanings.sent4: Her arguments were like fencings, deflecting any criticism that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The fencings demonstration left the audience in awe of the fencers' expertise.

meanings.definition: A barrier enclosing or bordering a field, yard, etc.
meanings.sent1: The wooden fencings around the garden kept the rabbits out.
meanings.sent2: The white picket fencings added a charming touch to the property.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to dig under the fencings and escape.
meanings.sent4: The fencings created a sense of privacy for the backyard barbecue.
meanings.sent5: The old stone fencings marked the boundary of the historic estate.

meanings.definition: The material used to make fences.
meanings.sent1: The hardware store stocked various types of fencings for different needs.
meanings.sent2: The farmer purchased rolls of wire fencings to repair the perimeter.
meanings.sent3: The colorful plastic fencings were easy to install around the flower beds.
meanings.sent4: The sturdy wooden fencings withstood the strong winds of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The metal fencings gleamed in the sunlight, adding a modern touch to the property.
